titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:17-0400

did.abstract: These are files concerning the Protomedicato, which was the Board of the King's Physician, or medical court, that regulated the medical profession in the Spanish colonies. There are additional files on this topic from the Universidad Nacional Autónoma. Also included on the film are documents relating to the Hospital Real de Indios.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by John Tate and accessioned, 09/--/1967 (1967 1876-80mf).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: For a report on Lanning's project, see American Philosophical Society "Year Book" 1967:563-564.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Instituto Nacional de Antropología e Historia, Mexico City, Mexico;Universidad Nacional Autónoma, Mexico City, Mexico.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.
